issue.title: [JS] Example usage in README is outdated
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2687](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2687). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
https://github.com/apache/arrow/tree/master/js#columns-are-what-youd-expect uses unknown function col.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2687?focusedCommentId=16508627) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I updated the JIRA title. Also I think that saying something is "what you'd expect" might discourage new users who aren't sure what to expect (it's kind of like saying something is "easy" [for you] when it may not be to someone else)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2687?focusedCommentId=16581584) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 2431
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2431>
